definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: It is also a fundamental tool for the rule laying down policy and law .
sentences.chinese: 它是统治者制定政策与法律的立脚点。

sentences.english: Local rulers were too weak to extirpate them.
sentences.chinese: 当地的统治者力量太弱，无法根除他们。

sentences.english: Unique combination of real time strategy with turn-based strategy, wonderful graphic, exciting gameplay allow you to feel yourself a real world ruler.
sentences.chinese: 令人激动的游戏让你认为自己是一个现实世界统治者。

sentences.english: The new nation needs a modern-minded ruler.
sentences.chinese: 这个新兴的国家需要有现代头脑之统治者。

sentences.english: He appointed his son, Senwesret I, as co-ruler.
sentences.chinese: 他还任命儿子赛恩沃斯里特一世为共同统治者。

sentences.english: Rulers in Beijing are belatedly trying to befriend his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 北京的统治者们才亡羊补牢的费心思去亲近他的敌人。

sentences.english: An absolute ruler can do just as he please.
sentences.chinese: 一个专制的统治者可以为所欲为。

sentences.english: Slobodan Milosevic of Serbia died in a Dutch prison.
sentences.chinese: 塞尔维亚统治者米洛舍维奇在一所荷兰监狱逝世。

sentences.english: Of course, the auto magnates used to be the Masters who ruled the world.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，汽车巨头们也当过世界统治者。

sentences.english: Their victims from the feudal system, become the accomplices of the feudal rulers.
sentences.chinese: 她们由封建制度的受害者，变成封建统治者的帮凶。

sentences.english: Rulers of the Qin Dynasty consciously combined the eastern six states cultures for two times.
sentences.chinese: 秦统治者有意识地对东方六国文化进行整合有两次。

sentences.english: This king was a good man, who took his responsibilities as ruler seriously.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王是位明君，认真地履行他统治者的责任。

sentences.english: For over three hundred years the rulers of the Roman Empire worshipped the god Mithras .
sentences.chinese: 三百多年以来，罗马帝国的统治者崇拜密特拉神。

sentences.english: This novel criticizes the peasants' uprising and sing the praises of the reactionary rulers.
sentences.chinese: 这本小说批判农民起义，但对反动统治者歌功颂德。

sentences.english: The year 1274 saw Mongol ruler Kublai Khan's first invasion of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 在一二七四年，蒙古统治者忽必烈汗第一次进侵日本。

sentences.english: After the Persians it was Alexander the Great's turn.
sentences.chinese: 继波斯帝国之后，阿富汗的统治者是亚历山大大帝。

definition: the imperial court/the government in imperial times
